Last night, the Vietnamese team had their
final match in Group D of the Asian Cup
against Iraq. Even though they were eliminated, the Vietnamese players
still played very
hard.  At minute 42, Van Khang was given a favorable penalty
that allowed him to score the opening goal. However, just a
few minutes later, Van Khang was too eager
to play high with the opponent and
had to receive a second yellow card to leave the field, causing
Iraq to have a second yellow card.  BN equalized with
Rabin Saka's header. In the 73rd minute, the
West Asian team took the lead with
another aerial attack from Aman Hussein. In the first minute of extra time,
Quang Hai scored
accurately to equalize the fourth penalty as if the match would
end.  With the score, right in the
final moments of extra time, Iraq
received a penalty and he
succeeded to set the score 3-2. Iraq won the
championship with three matches in the month.
